title: The three worthy butchers of the north I weep, I wail, and travel much in pain, now all my youthful days are past, they'l never come again; once I was a man, but now alas I am none, for all my companions are from me fled and gone. To a pleasant new tune.
author: Burges, Paul.
publicationStmtPublisher: Printed for P. Brooksby, in West-smithfield,
